DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim study assess effect habitual dietary protein intake across acceptable macronutrient distribution range lean beef/pork soy/legumes predominate source protein index daily appetite mood , postprandial appetite , mood , energy expenditure , glycemic response energy-restricted weight loss overweight adult .

DOC.criteria: Age range : 21 year old Body mass index 27.036.9 kg/m2 Nonsmoking ( within last 6 month ) Weight stable ( < 3 kg ( ~7 lbs ) weight gain loss within last 3 month ) Energy need weight maintenance 19502750 kcal/day Not dietary restrain Menstruating woman pregnant lactate Constant habitual activity pattern ( within last 3 month ) No Acute Illness ( chronic disease know influence protein energy metabolism ) Nondiabetic Clinically normal blood profile ( within 10 % clinical normalcy ) Nonhypertensive Not take medication know influence appetite metabolism Willingness eat study food Able travel test facility Age : < 21 year Body mass index : outside 27.036.9 kg/m2 range Smoker ( currently within last 6 month ) Gained lose > 3.0 kg ( 7 lb ) within last 3 month Energy need weight maintenance < 1950 > 2750 kcal/day Dietary restrain ( â‰¥ 14 Three Factor Eating Questionnaire ) Pregnant , lactating , nonmenstruating woman Clinically diagnose diabetic , liver kidney disease/dysfunction , osteoporosis Clinically abnormal blood profile identify study physician , Arthur Rosen , MD Hypertensive Taking medication ( currently within last 3 month ) know influence appetite metabolism Allergies egg Lactose intolerance Unwillingness eat study food Inability travel test facility
